thread.title: Joliet Catholic football handed first loss by Benet
thread.title_full: Joliet Catholic football handed first loss by Benet

title: Joliet Catholic football handed first loss by Benet
text:
Joliet Catholic football handed first loss by Benet Published: Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 12:16 a.m. CDT By MIKE FITZGERALD - Shaw Media Correspondent 
LISLE –“We’ll be alright.” Related Links Minooka football stumbles at Oswego East, falls 17-8 
That’s what Joliet Catholic coach Dan Sharp told his team after Benet upset the Hilltoppers, 24-21, Friday in the East Suburban Catholic game. 
Joliet Catholic trailed Benet 24-14 with 2:45 to play in the fourth quarter before mounting a nine-play, 63-yard scoring drive. Quarterback Cade Earl hit receiver Bill Rotnicki with a 19-yard touchdown pass to cut the deficit to 24-21 with 1:26 to play. 
The Hilltoppers did not recover the ensuing onside kick, and Benet (6-2, 4-2) ran out the clock. 
Joliet Catholic (7-1, 5-1) never led in the game, and the Redwings bottled up Hilltoppers’ running backs Michael Johnson (86 yards rushing) and Ke’Von Johnson (72 yards rushing). 
Earl threw three touchdown passes to account for the Joliet Catholic scores. He threw two to Rotnicki and one to Michael Johnson. 
Joliet Catholic turned the ball over four times in the second half. Michael Johnson fumbled twice and Earl was intercepted twice. 
The Hilltoppers also were penalized nine times for 92 yards in the game. 
“Benet played very well. They tackled well. They got off their blocks well," Sharp said. "It seemed every time we got something going offensively, there would be a penalty or they would create a turnover. You’re not going to win many games against a good team when you turn the ball over four times. We never got into a rhythm offensively.”
